laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal white-cell differential count; blood levels of electrolytes, calcium, glucose, urea nitrogen, and creatinine were normal.
Indeterminate nodule (3 mm in diameter) in the left upper lobe; otherwise normal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT revealed enlarging lung metastases.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT scans (5 months after tumor resection)
laboratory_examinations.findings: Decrease in the size of the L5–S1 mass of more than 50% and reduction in the size of the duodenal metastasis of more than 80%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Five months after radiotherapy, the patient had a left ureteral obstruction.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Reveal decrease in the size of the L5–S1 mass of more than 50% and reduction in the size of the duodenal metastasis of more than 80%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Chest CT revealed enlarging lung metastases.
